definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: Pyongyang has recent withdrawn two mid-range missiles which had been poised far on the country's east coast.
sentences.chinese: 平壤近期撤走了位於東海岸的兩枚中程導彈。

sentences.english: The Mayas do not just disappeared, they were evacuated by spaceships and flew away.
sentences.chinese: 瑪雅人並非突然消失了，而是搭乘宇宙飛船撤走了。

sentences.english: The UN has already started to withdraw its non-essential staff.
sentences.chinese: 聯合國現在已經開始撤走不必要的員工。

sentences.english: Beijing withdrew its forces from Korea years ago and turned responsibility over to the North. But we are still there with 28,500 U.S. military personnel, including some at the demilitarized zone.
sentences.chinese: 北京多年前就撤走軍隊，把責任交給朝鮮。

sentences.english: Han Jinquan lead to evacuate, BDBD hedge had also removed.
sentences.chinese: 韓金銓帶頭撤離，魏東籬只好也撤走。

sentences.english: Much was evacuated, but even more would have to be destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 它們當中有許多被撤走了，但更多的是被消毀。

sentences.english: Mourners chanted slogans calling for the removal of the government.
sentences.chinese: 哀悼者高呼口號政府呼籲撤走。

sentences.english: The army pulled back after the battle.
sentences.chinese: 部隊在結束戰鬥以後，撤走了。

sentences.english: The unit recoil at over the fight.
sentences.chinese: 部隊在結束戰鬥以後撤走了。

sentences.english: That is why I ordered the removal of our combat brigades by next August.
sentences.chinese: 這就是我下令在明年8月前撤走我們的作戰旅的原因。

sentences.english: Please enjoy it! And can I take this away?
sentences.chinese: 請慢用，這個可以給你撤走嗎？

sentences.english: When the rear-guard of his army retreated, the front giving way too.
sentences.chinese: 當他的後衛撤走，前方也在敗退。

sentences.english: The few soldiers there withdrew in panic.
sentences.chinese: 駐守在那裏的幾個士兵倉皇地撤走了。

sentences.english: In 1966 the British announced that all its forces would be withdrawn at independence.
sentences.chinese: 1966年英國宣佈其獨立並撤走所有武裝力量。

definition: to withdraw/to leave/to retreat/to pull out
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
